content:
• Tuesday, August 20, 2013
  • EGC

    Energy XXI +3.8% AH following big FQ4 earnings beat

    • Energy XXI (EXXI) +3.8% AH following FQ4 earnings that easily beat analyst estimates.
    • Production averaged 46,800 boe/day, 62% of which was oil, vs. 47,600 boe/day in the year-ago quarter.
    • FY 2013 year-end proved reserves were ~179M boe, up 50% from a year earlier; 62M boe of proved reserves through discoveries, extensions of existing fields and performance revisions, in addition to 13M boe through acquisitions.
    • EXXI continued a string of drilling successes in the quarter, including Big Sky 3, Java and Monte Carlo 2.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:36 PM

  • After-hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: OTCPK:IMUC +6%. ZA +3%. MRGE +3%. PT-OLD +2%. ALSK +2%.
    • Top losers: OESX -7%. NAVB -5%. WNR -4%. KBH -4%. AMPE -4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:40 PM | 2 Comments
  • LZB

    La-Z-Boy's profit beats estimates, same-store sales rise double-digits

    • Shares of La-Z-Boy (NYSE:LZB) rise 1.2% AH following the company's FQ1 results.
    • Same-store written sales rise 12.7% during the period. "This quarter marks two and a half years of double-digit same-store sales growth for the La-Z-Boy Furniture Galleries network of stores," CEO Kurt Darrow notes.
    • Operating income jumps 94%.
    • Retail segment swings to a $1.9M profit versus a $2M operating loss in Q1 2012.
    • Darrow says he is confident that the company is "well positioned to capitalize on a strengthening economy, particularly as housing continues to recover." (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:00 PM
  • VELTF

    Velti writing down $111M in receivables, looking to sell Mobclix

    • Velti (VELT) blames the write-down on "a deterioration in collections" from customers in Greece and Cyprus; Deloitte has been hired to assist with collection attempts. The company has already divested assets in international markets with very high collection times.
    • No formal guidance is given in the Q2 report, but Velti says it's looking to "become profitable and cash flow positive in 2014." The company previously guided for 2013 free cash flow of $5M-$15M.
    • Velti says it has hired an i-bank to find a buyer for its Mobclix U.S. mobile ad network, and is exploring "other strategic opportunities" for the unit. VentureBeat recently reported Mobclix developer partners are up in arms over delinquent payments that may total $30M.
    • Q2 free cash flow (exc. acquisition-related payments) was -$3.3M, and the company's cash position stood at $19.4M. Velti has already gone through with major job cuts. Can the company avoid Chap. 11?
    • Shares -31% AH. CC underway.
    • Q2 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 4:50 PM | 2 Comments
  • KTCC

    Key Tronic plunges on Q2 results

    • Key Tronic Corporation (NASDAQ:KTCC): Q2 EPS of $0.22 misses by $0.02.
    • Revenue of $84.6M misses by $12.1M. Shares -13.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:38 PM
  • LZB

    La-Z-Boy beats by $0.03, misses on revenues

    • La-Z-Boy (NYSE:LZB): FQ1 EPS of $0.18 beats by $0.03.
    • Revenue of $318.9M (+5.8% Y/Y) misses by $4.12M. Shares +1.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM
  • VNET

    More on 21Vianet Q2 results

    • 21Vianet's (NASDAQ:VNET) adjusted EBITDA rose 23.8% Y/Y to $14.2M (RMB87.2M).
    • Management issued in-line guidance for Q3 of revenue of $83M-$$85M (RMB508M-RMB520M) and for adjusted EBITDA of $15M-$17M (RMB92M-RMB102M).
    •  Operational highlights: Monthly Recurring Revenues per data storage cabinet grew 1.3% Q/Q. Total cabinets managed rose 2.2% Q/Q to 12,226. Utilization rose by 2.1% from Q1 to 70.2%. Churn rate ticked down to 1.47% from 1.75% in Q1 (top 20 customers' churn remained 0%).
    • Conference call scheduled for 8pm ET
     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM
  • ADI

    Analog Devices beats by $0.03, beats on revenues

    • Analog Devices (NASDAQ:ADI): FQ3 EPS of $0.57 beats by $0.03.
    • Revenue of $674M beats by $2.3M. Shares -1.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM
  • VELTF

    Velti dives on higher Q2 net losses

    • Velti (VELT): Q2 EPS of -$0.25 misses by $0.04.
    • Revenue of $31.19M (-47% Y/Y) misses by $11.96M. Shares -32% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM | 1 Comment
  • INTU

    Intuit (INTU) declares quarterly dividend of $0.19/share

    • Intuit (NASDAQ:INTU) bumps it quarterly dividend to $0.19/share from $0.17/share, representing an annual yield of 1.20%.
    • The dividend is payable in 18 Oct, to shareholders on record of Oct 10. Shares -2.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM
  • VNET

    21Vianet misses by $0.03, beats on revenues

    • 21Vianet (NASDAQ:VNET): Q2 EPS of $0.05 misses by $0.03.
    • Revenue of $76.8M (+29.3% Y/Y) beats by $0.63M. Shares -1.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM
  • AVAV

    dealReporter: AeroVironment could see M&A interest

    • The report led AeroVironment (AVAV +4.1%) shares to spike higher just a little before the close.
    • 12.6% of the UAV manufacturer's float was shorted as of July 31.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:02 PM
  • GASS

    StealthGas plunges on Q2 miss, CEO not happy

    • "In general I am not happy with the quarter," StealthGas (GASS -9.5%) CEO Harry Vafias says, regarding what looks like a rather large bottom line Q2 miss.
    • Shares are off sharply following the report, which showed revenues rose 4.1% Y/Y for the quarter.
    • Net income fell 29%.
    • Vafias notes that in July the company did manage to secure "long term charters for three ... vessels that had come off charter." (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:36 PM | 3 Comments
  • TSL

    Trina Solar gets two upgrades following better than expected Q2

    • Trina Solar (TSL +13.5%) is upgraded to Buy from Hold with a $9.50 target price at Maxim Group, which says volumes appear back on track following several quarters in which TSL was surprisingly weak in sales and execution (Q2 results).
    • TSL again is showing the leverage in its model, the firm says; excluding one-time charges, it would have reported 13.7% gross margin and an operating margin nearly back to income breakeven - a dramatic improvement from the negative "clean" operating margin it reported for Q1.
    • Shares also are upgraded to Buy from Hold at Ardour Capital, which hikes its target to $10 from $5 citing higher 2013 guidance and better than expected margins.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:29 PM | 2 Comments
  • PWRD

    Perfect World continues fall on cost concerns, Morgan Stanley downgrade

    • Shares of Perfect World (PWRD -6.6%) continue the descent they began during AH yesterday. Although the Chinese web/mobile game maker beat Q2 consensus and issued strong Q3 guidance, investors appear to have been left wanting.
    • A chief concern is ballooning costs. Cost of revenue grew 37% Y/Y in Q2 while opex grew 18.6% Y/Y. Revenue was up 4.7% in the same period. Marketing expenses were the largest culprit, up 60.1% Y/Y. Pacific Crest noted, "Q3 guidance is strong but spending is expected to remain elevated."
    • Morgan Stanley chopped its rating earlier today to Equal Weight from Overweight following Perfect World's Q2 release: "This mainly reflects rich valuation. Perfect World is trading at 10.7x 2014e P/E, vs. 4.6-10.8x for peers." However, the bank raised its PT to $20, reflecting its expectation of strong revenue growth in 2H on the back of "strong reception of new games such as Saint Seiya Online and Swordsman Online."
    • Perfect World is up 81.1% YTD, its climb nearly two-fold that of peers.
    • Other Chinese game makers: Shanda Games (NASDAQ:GAME), NetEase (NASDAQ:NTES), Giant Interactive (NYSE:GA)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:22 PM
  • HGG

    Big box retailers rally together

    • Shares of hhgregg (HGG +3.1%) and Conn's (CONN +2.9%) trade higher after Best Buy (BBY +12%) grows profits at a decent clip in Q2.
    • The big box retailers have had some success cutting costs and shifting their mix toward higher-margin appliance products.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:57 PM
  • BBY

    Best Buy no longer cheap: KeyBanc

    • "While shares are not expensive, they are also no longer trading at a significant discount," KeyBanc's Bradley Thomas says, regarding the rally in Best Buy (BBY +12.5%) following Q2 results.
    • Despite losing its bargain status, the shares may still be worth a look, as Thomas notes that "new product launches in H2, as well as the Samsung Experience and other space optimization efforts could drive improved revenue trends in coming quarters."
    • KeyBanc's FY14 EPS estimate is hiked to $2.42 from $2.25. Consensus is $2.20.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:53 PM
  • TIVO

    TiVo unveils Roamio DVR family to good reviews, shares higher

    • The new DVRs represent TiVo's (TIVO +4.8%) first big refresh since 2011 (when the Premiere Elite was launched), and are priced at $200 (the base Roamio model), $400 (the Roamio Plus), and $600 (the Roamio Pro). (PR)
    • The Roamio line (specs) offers more storage (500GB-3TB) and tuners (4-6) than comparable models in the prior-gen Premiere line, as well as a revamped UI and (eventually) a Slingbox-like ability to stream live and recorded content to mobile devices that have a TiVo app installed.
    • Support for video downloads, and the streaming of mobile content to TVs (via the DIAL protocol), is also  included.
    • The Verge gives the Roamio Pro a score of 8.0/10, and calls it "the ultimate DVR." Time: "Tthe Roamio models are a polished and powerful way to watch TV."
    • TiVo has been facing stiff competition from integrated set-top/DVR solutions offered by pay-TV providers, and from Internet-only boxes from the likes of Apple and Roku. But the company's own partnerships with pay-TV providers have been gaining traction lately. TiVo's MSO sub base rose by 277K in FQ1, aided by a 172K increase for the U.K.'s Virgin Media.
    • FQ2 results arrive on Aug. 27.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:47 PM
  • ANW

    Aegean Marine defended at Cowen, which sees selloff as buying opportunity

    • Aegean Marine Petroleum (OTC:ANW -8.7%) is defended at Cowen, which raises its price target to $10.50 from $9 following today's selloff after disappointing Q2 results.
    • Cowen views the share drop as a buying opportunity given a pickup in shipping activity in Q3, additional clarity on Fujairah and cost savings, and growing return of capital potential.
    • With debt repayment and expected capex minimal through 2015, the firm sees increasing probability for enhanced return of capital initiatives, which it thinks will bring shares to its new $10.50 target.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:46 PM
  • CSH

    Cash America jumps on Janney upgrade

    • Cash America International (CSH +7.6%) soars after Janney Montgomery upgrades the shares to Buy from Neutral.
    • The stock currently trades at an "excessive discount" as the market has more than priced in "the risk of negative payday regulation."
    • Price target is $49.
    • Peers trading higher include FCFS +1.9% and WRLD +2.8%,
     
     
     
     
    | 2:34 PM
  • ZIOP

    Ziopharm spikes midday

    • Ziopharm (ZIOP +6%) spikes suddenly.
    • The stock was trading higher by ~2.5% midday.
    • At around 1:30 shares abruptly jumped to trade higher by as much as 9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:19 PM
  • PLUG

    Plug Power gains on Mercedes-Benz US International order for its fuel cell units

    • Plug Power (PLUG +6.8%) gains after saying that Mercedes-Benz US International has ordered 123 additional hydrogen-based GenDrive fuel cell units to power new forklift trucks for its material handling fleet at a logistics hub now under construction in Tuscaloosa, Alabama.
    • Last July, Mercedes purchased 72 GenDrive fuel cells for the lift truck fleet at its Tuscaloosa vehicle assembly plant.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:11 PM
  • MICR

    Arrhythmia Research Technology delays filing its Q2 earnings report

    • Arrhythmia Research Technology (HRT) says it didn't file its quarterly earnings report by the August 19 due date because of an ongoing review into the valuation of deferred tax assets.
    • On a preliminary basis, the company said it expects to report Q2 revenue rose 1.9% to $4.88M from a revised $4.79M a year ago.
    • It also sees its net loss for the three months ended in June narrowing to $328,022 from a $1.04M loss in the year-ago period.
    • The stock was halted earlier, but has since resumed trading.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:51 PM
  • NYMT

    New York Mortgage Trust CEO picks up company shares

    • New York Mortgage Trust (NYMT +4.1%) CEO Steven Mumma adds to his stake in the company, purchasing 25K shares today at $5.65 each. The purchase increases by nearly 15% his company holdings which now total more than 195K shares.
    • After today's big gain, the stock's off about 19% over the last 90 days.
    • Earlier: Another mREIT insider buy as the AG Mortgage Investment CEO steps in.
    • Mortgage REIT ETFs: REM, MORT, MORL.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:26 PM
  • EA

    EA makes new 52-week amidst flurry of Gamescom announcements

    • Ahead of the Aug. 21-25 Gamescom conference, Electronic Arts (EA +3.3%) has made a slew of announcements. Among other things, EA has:
    • Boasted Plants vs. Zombies 2, launched last Thursday on iOS, has already seen over 16M downloads, which leads the company to call it "the most successful mobile game launch in EA's history."  The title topped App Store game download charts in 137 countries, and has an average rating of 4.5/5 stars.
    • Revealed details about Battlefield 4 Premium, the $50 service attached to the next release for EA's top first-person shooter franchise (due Oct. 29). 5 digital expansion packs and 12 "battlepacks" are provided with a subscription.
    • Announced FIFA 14 (due Sep. 24-27) will include a new online mode and various Latin American clubs not previously covered. The FIFA franchise has been one of EA's biggest international successes.
    • Released a gameplay trailer (video) for The Sims 4 (due in 2014).
    • Shares have made new 52-week highs, and are up 47% since John Riccitiello's resignation was announced on March 18.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:21 PM
  • TXCCQ

    TranSwitch rallies on communication processor contract

    • TranSwitch (TXCC +19.6%) is rallying after the company announces Indian conglomerate Reliance Industries has selected its Atlanta 80 communication processor as part of its 4G LTE network build out. The product will enable Reliance subsidiary Jio Infocomm's new network to support high-speed data and Voice over LTE services.
    • With India's data usage mushrooming, the contract could be a big score for TranSwitch. Roll out is expected to begin in H2 of 2013 and continue with a multi-year plan in place.
    • Previous: TranSwitch plummets after announcing voluntary Nasdaq delisting
     
     
     
     
    | 12:50 PM | 1 Comment

  • Midday top 10 gainers / Losers

    • Midday top 10 gainers: NFEC +21%. PULS-OLD +18%. RNET +15%. XOMA +15%. COCO +13%. ELTK +14%. SCON +11%. PSUN +11%. CPSS +10%. AFFM.OB +7%.
    • Midday top 10 Losers: LITB -34%. OTCPK:MKTY -19%. PLCC -18%. ALVR -16%. BKS -15%. OTC:PURE -14%. OTC:ANW -13%. NAII -13%. FMAR.OB -13%. CBAK-OLD -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • JCP

    Wells Fargo says some J.C. Penney customers gone for good

    • "Taking a step back, this is a company selling product at lower margins than a year ago, and they still can't drive traffic or conversion (both were down), which tells us many of the customers they lost are gone for good," Wells Fargo's Paul Lejuez says, taking a decidedly downbeat stance on J.C. Penney's (JCP +3.7%) quarter.
    • Lejuez also thinks the company's plans to invest in marketing and store payroll may mean the beleaguered retailer will need "additional liquidity next year to funding working capital" if the situation doesn't turn around in relatively short order.
    • Underperform rating maintained. Price target is $10-11.
    • Earlier: Earnings, earnings highlights, heard on the JCP conference call
     
     
     
     
    | 11:54 AM | 11 Comments
  • AMGN

    Maxim upgrades Onyx Pharmaceuticals to Buy; says Amgen deal likely

    • As the Street sweats out a deal, Maxim Group analyst Echo He agrees with ISI and thinks that Amgen (AMGN +1.3%) is serious about buying Onyx Pharmaceuticals (ONXX +3%), and upgrades the shares to Buy with a $130 price target.
    • He says AMGN's asking for FOCUS data means they are seriously interested, and believes ONXX is motivated to do a deal as well.
    • Maxim thinks a deal could be valued at more than $120 per share, which puts the rumored $130 price tag within reach.
    • The firm puts a fundamental value on the shares at around $130 - $140.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM
  • NDZ

    Nordion settles lawsuit with Atomic Energy of Canada

    • Nordion (NDZ +7%) gains after announcing it's settled a dispute with isotope supplier Atomic Energy of Canada, receiving C$15M in cash.
    • Under the terms of the agreement, Atomic Energy has also released its C$47M claim against NDZ for arbitration costs while NDZ dropped its countersuit.
    • The two parties have also agreed on a new isotope supply agreement running through October 31, 2016.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM
  • PSUN

    PacSun, Zumiez, Tilly's outperform

    • Shares of Pacific Sunwear (PSUN +9.1%) trade sharply higher, perhaps benefiting from Urban Outfitter's Q2 report which showed comps for its Free People, Bohemian fashion segment rose 38% during the period.
    • Back in June, Wedbush's Betty Chen flagged PSUN as a stock likely to benefit from "current fashion trends of Bohemian to Festival [which are] rooted in the California lifestyle."
    • Chen also said Zumiez (ZUMZ +3.9%) and Tilly's (TLYS +1.73%) were likely to outperform — both are notably higher on the session.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:20 AM
  • MITT

    AG Mortgage CEO adds to company stake

    • AG Mortgage Investment Trust (MITT +2.9%) CEO David Roberts took advantage of yesterday's sharp drop to add about 67% to his stake in the company, buying 4.9K shares at $16.78 on Monday and another 44.6K shares at $16.17.
    • The stock's off 37% over the last three months.
    • Earlier: Mortgage REIT sector bounces from yesterday's drubbing.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM | 2 Comments
  • NFEC

    NF Energy announces energy efficiency services contract, shares +19%

    • NF Energy Saving (NFEC +18.9%) shares spike after the Chinese company announces an energy efficiency services contract with Dongguan Xianjia Plastic Products to retrofit injection molding machines.
    • With the new project, NFEC expects energy service projects in the plastic industry to become a new source of revenue.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM
  • NLY

    Sizable bounce for mortgage REITs

    • Sector giants Annaly (NLY +3.3%) and American Capital Agency (AGNC +4.3%) are the leading gainers, followed but Armour (ARR +2.6%), MFA (MFA +2.7%), Dynex (DX +2.8%), New York Mortgage (NYMT +3.3%), and Western Asset (WMC +2.8%) as interest rates take a breather from going up.
    • Earlier: This year's Treasury bear market may be the worst one yet.
    • Especially ugly trade in the preferreds of many of the agency mortgage REITs have some traders wondering if retail panic isn't ringing a bell for a bottom in the sector. Today, the action isn't necessarily ugly, but it is sloppy - with different preferreds of the same issuer (Armour, for example I, II) trading in different directions even as both represent the same credit risk.
    • ETFs: (REM +2.4%), (MORT +2.7%), (MORL +5.8%).
     
     
     
     
    | 10:50 AM | 24 Comments
  • CNTF

    China Techfaith plunges on Q2 results

    • China Techfaith (CNTF -10.6%) plunges after the company announces Q2 results.
    • Revenue grew 6.8% Y/Y to $30.2M. Original Developed Product revenue grew 48.9% Y/Y to $20.1M, Game revenue fell 77.8% Y/Y to $1.6M, and Brand Name Phone Sales revenue fell 28.8% Y/Y to $8.4M. (PR)
    • Gross profit fell 53.4% Y/Y to $3.4M.
    • The company provided Q3 guidance for revenue of $29M-$33M. On the conference call, management stated, "We do not expect business levels to improve dramatically over the near term ... [T]he broader environment remains very challenging."
     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM
  • COCO

    Corinthian Colleges not out of the woods: Compass Point

    • Compass Point maintains a Sell rating on shares of Corinthian Colleges (COCO +15.3%) despite favorable news regarding its 2012 composite score.
    • Analyst Michael Tarkan reminds investors that COCO's 2011 composite (0.9) puts it technically in violation of a debt covenant.
    • Tarkan also points out what we noted here earlier: The 2012 score remains under review.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:44 AM
  • GLCNF

    Glencore needs some of its own medicine, WSJ's Peaple writes

    • The latest results for Glencore (OTCPK:GLCNF -1.9%) and BHP (BHP -0.8%) show the good times are over for global miners (I, II), but the outlook is more difficult at Glencore, Andrew Peaple writes.
    • Glencore's trading business performed reasonably well in H1 with operating profit up 6.4% despite tough markets, but trading is a low-margin business where it faces tighter regulatory scrutiny amid stiff competition.
    • Even excluding the $7.7B writedown from the Xstrata merger, Glencore's EBITDA was down 9% in H1, vs. a 1% gain at BHP over the same period.
    • Glencore's outspoken Ivan Glasenberg has criticized peers for wasteful investment and not taming supply growth, but "it is time the physician healed himself," Peaple writes.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM
  • RRGB

    Jefferies positive on Red Robin comps, remodels

    • Red Robin Gourmet Burgers (RRGB +3.8%) is upgraded to Buy from Hold at Jefferies.
    • Analyst Andy Barish thinks same-store sales "can surprise in coming quarters and drive EPS upside as the introduction of incremental new menu news drives check growth."
    • KeyBanc and Wunderlich have taken similar views and the company hiked its comps guidance when it released Q2 results.
    • Barish also thinks remodels can ultimately lead to $0.50 in extra EPS by FY15/16 by driving a 50 bps increase in annual traffic growth.
    • Price target is hiked to $72 from $53.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:26 AM
  • ALXN

    Alexion Pharmaceuticals shares bounce back

    • Alexion Pharmaceuticals (ALXN +0.9%) is showing to be resilient today, bouncing back from an early dip on reports of a voluntary recall of of some potentially contaminated vials of Soliris.
    • Adding insult-to-injury, CEO Leonard Bell reported that he sold 140,000 shares on Thursday at an average price of $106.08.
    • The total transaction represented nearly 8% of Mr. Leonard's outstanding shares, amounting to around $14.8M in net proceeds.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:20 AM
  • LITB

    LightInTheBox continues descent, analysts raise concerns

    • LightInTheBox (LITB -39%) extends losses it suffered AH yesterday following its disappointing Q2 results.
    • With revenue growth slowing in Q2 to 52.6% Y/Y and guidance for Q3 Y/Y growth of 33%-37%, Barron's wonders how the cross-border retailer can reach the annual revenue growth target of 64% it reportedly ponied during its roadshow.
    • Credit Suisse cut the stock to Underperform earlier today. T.H. Capital's Tian Thou raised concerns about the security of LightInTheBox's competitive pricing advantage as COGS of Chinese products rises and the Renminbi appreciates. And Oppenheimer's Andrew Yeung notes, " A majority of products on sale at LITB are white-label or generic products and repeat customer sales account[ed] for less than 25% of total sales in 2012." That metric has expanded to 32.4% in Q2.
    • The stock now sits up 23.6% from its IPO price, after being up as much as 146.1% in Aug.
    • Shares of other Chinese Internet retailers are taking a sympathy dive: Vipshop (VIPS -5.4%), Dangdang (DANG -5.7%).
     
     
     
     
    | 10:18 AM | 1 Comment
  • FB

    Zynga lower, Facebook slightly up after Janney starts coverage

    • Janney's Tony Wilbe and Murali Sankar have started coverage of Facebook (FB +0.4%) with a Buy and $50 PT, and Zynga (ZNGA -2.8%) with a Sell and $2.50 PT. Zynga is selling off; Facebook opened higher, but has since pared its gains.
    • In addition to making the usual comments about Facebook's mobile potential, the analysts argue Facebook has "a unique opportunity to gain [ad] share by working with TV networks," in light of research indicating U.S. consumers are increasingly using smart devices during ad breaks rather than fast-forwarding ads.
    • They also argue Facebook is "ideally positioned to break historical barriers to entry" in the payments market (previous) on account of its 1M ad buyers, 1.1B users, and widespread adoption of Facebook Connect by third-party sites/apps.
    • But with regards to Zynga, Wilbe and Sankar assert the company is seeing a "vicious cycle" of declining game activity and friend-to-friend promotional work. Tough competition and a changing relationship with Facebook are also raised as concerns.
    • Oddly enough, the analysts also suggest next-gen console launches are a threat to both Zynga and Facebook's gaming-related revenue, and that "a substantial portion" of Zynga's 1.9M unique payers are hard-core gamers. The FarmVille and Call of Duty user bases aren't historically known for having huge overlap.
    • Sell-side commentary on Facebook has been quite bullish (I, II) lately.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM | 3 Comments
  • HLF

    Perry Capital buys into Herbalife, shares rise

    • Herbalife (NYSE:HLF) shares +3.1% following a report that Perry Capital has bought a stake of under 5% in the company.
    • Perry Capital joins Carl Icahn, who owns 16.5%, and George Soros in taking long positions in Herbalife.
    • Meanwhile, Icahn has asked a court to throw out a lawsuit from a Herbalife (HLF) shortseller who has accused the activist investor of improperly supporting the company's shares in order get even with Bill Ackman over a previous legal loss.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:04 AM | 9 Comments
  • SA

    Seabridge Gold nears second high-grade core zone discovery at KSM

    • Seabridge Gold (SA +2.7%) says results from the first three holes testing for a high-grade core zone below the Iron Cap deposit on its KSM project show strong evidence to support the potential for a major discovery; further drilling on the target is planned next month.
    • Last week, SA said it discovered a large core zone below the Kerr deposit at KSM, where drilling to date has generated wide intercepts containing about twice the per-ton metal value of KSM's proven and probable reserve.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:59 AM | 2 Comments
  • KGC

    Kinross says Tasiast mine strike ends, production impact minimal

    • Kinross Gold (KGC +3.2%) says the strike by unionized workers at its Tasiast mine in Mauritania that started earlier this month has ended with a "minimal" impact on production.
    • KGC says its FY 2013 production guidance remains unchanged at 2.4M-2.6M attributable gold equivalent oz.; Tasiast produced 185K gold equivalent oz. in 2012.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:48 AM

  • Southeast Asian shares decline as Indonesia falls to 11-month low

    • Another precipitous decline for the JCI (stocks finished more than 3% lower in Jakarta following Monday's rout) drags regional markets lower in Southeast Asia.
    • Thai (THD), Malaysian (EWM), and Vietnamese (VNM) shares slide 2%, 1.9%, and 1.2% respectively, while the Straits Times (EWS, EWSS) dips 1.4%.
    • Philippine markets (EPHE) were closed again for rain and flooding and will reopen Thursday following a holiday Wednesday.
    • More from Indonesia: Stocks (IDX, EIDO) are now negative for the year as the JCI sits at its lowest level since last September. According to Reuters, state pension funds are apparently stepping in to scoop up bargains, while one broker warns fearful investors against "throwing the baby out with the bathwater."
    • While Indonesian shares may look like a bargain, there's still the looming Fed taper and although further rate hikes may work to stabilize the flagging rupiah, there's a painful tradeoff with economic growth.
    • Indonesia small cap ETF: IDXJ

  • TJX

    More on TJX's Q2 results, shares +4.1% premarket

    • TJX Companies (NYSE:TJX) +4.1% premarket after Q2 earnings and revenue beat estimates and bucked the trend of weak results at several retailers including Macy's and Wal-Mart.
    • Same-store sales rose 4%, beating analyst consensus of a 3% gain; TJX says it expects same-store sales to rise 2%-3% in the current quarter.
    • Gross profit margin was 28.8% vs. 28.1% a year ago, driven by strong merchandise margin improvement and buying and occupancy expense leverage on above-plan sales.
    • For Q3, sees EPS of $0.69-$0.72 vs. $0.71 consensus, with same-store sales up 2%-3%; raises FY 2014 EPS to $2.74-$2.80 from $2.70-$2.78 and $2.82 consensus, with sale-store sales up 2%-3% from up 1%-2%.

  • COCO

    Corinthian Colleges will not be required to post letter of credit

    • Corinthian Colleges (NASDAQ:COCO) clears a major hurdle as the Department of Education puts the company's composite score at 0.9 for 2011 and 1.5 for 2012. (8-K)
    • The 2012 score is the saving grace here as it means the company will not be required to post a letter of credit and will remain eligible to participate in Title IV programs (schools with scores below 1 can still participate in Title IV under a provisional certification).
    • Although the 2012 score will not be adjusted in the near-term, the Department of Education is still reviewing the company's treatment of $16.3M in a "borrowings under student notes receivable sale agreement."
    • Previous: BofA's David Chu flags letter of credit overhang at COCO
    • Shares +12% premarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:44 AM | 1 Comment

    • Trina Solar's (NYSE:TSL) Q2 net loss narrowed to $0.47/ADS from $1.30/ADS in the year-ago quarter, as it shipped 647 MW of PV modules vs. 393 MW shipped in Q1 and 419 MW shipped a year earlier.
